instructions: In Find My iPhone on iCloud.com, tap the device you want to play a sound on in the Devices list. Tap Play Sound. If the device is online , a sound starts after a short delay and gradually increases in volume, then plays for about 2 minutes. A Find My [ device ] alert also appears on the device s screen. If the device is offline , the sound plays the next time it connects to a Wi-Fi or cellular network. To return to the Devices list, tap the Close button .

In Find My iPhone on iCloud.com, tap the AirPods you want to play a sound on in the Devices list. Tap Play Sound. If your AirPods are online , they play a sound immediately (for 2 minutes). If they re offline , you receive a notification the next time your AirPods are in range of your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch. Important: Make sure to remove the AirPods from your ears before playing a sound. Although the sound starts playing softly, the volume gradually increases. This could cause discomfort for anyone wearing the AirPods. If your AirPods are separated, tap Mute Left or Mute Right to find them one at a time. To return to the Devices list, tap the Close button .
From any home screen, tap Apps . Tap Settings . Under QUICK SETTINGS , tap Data usage . Tap Menu , then tap Restrict background data to turn it ON / OFF . Tap OK .

From any home screen, tap Apps . Tap Settings . Under USER AND BACKUP , tap Accounts . Under MY ACCOUNTS , tap the accounts and apps to sync. Select the account at the top of the screen. Tap Menu > Sync now .
From any Home screen, tap the Apps icon . Tap Settings . Scroll to 'System,' then tap Language and input . Tap Language . Tap the desired language.
